business.headline: Sensex falls over 100 points, Nifty down slightly; Jio Financial rises 1%Sensex falls over 100 points, Nifty down slightly; Jio Financial rises 1%

Why Gautam Adani celebrates three birthdays every yearBaffling as it may seem, apart from the day he was born, Adani celebrates two other dates. They are dates when he actually snatched life from the jaws of death. These were times when he repeatedly stared down the abyss and emerged unscathed, yet profoundly transformed. Here then is the story of Adani's three birthdays.

India-US trade deal: Is Trump's 'big deal' claim a pressure tactic? Experts weigh inUS President Donald Trump on Thursday announced a trade deal with China on rare earths and hinted at a 'very big' trade agreement with India.

Wall Street rallies to record highs as AI stocks soar, recession fears easeUS stock markets hit all-time highs on Friday thanks to an AI boom and Fed hints at looser policy ahead. Trade deals with the UK and China have also fuelled market hopes that a global recession could be avoided.

HDFC Bank slashes FD and savings rates again in June. Details hereHDFC Bank's latest changes signal that deposit rates could remain soft if the RBI continues its rate-cutting cycle. Depositors should review their plans, stay updated with rate changes, and make informed decisions before booking new FDs or RDs.

EPFO may soon allow direct EPF withdrawals via ATMs and UPIThe EPFO recently increased the auto-settlement limit from Rs 1 lakh to Rs 5 lakh. This means members can get up to Rs 5 lakh cleared automatically within three days for things like medical expenses, education, housing, or marriage.
Sensex ends 300 points higher, Nifty above 25,600; Jio Financial shares jump 4%The S&P BSE Sensex ended 303.03 points higher at 84,058.90, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 88.80 to settle at 25,637.80.

Switched jobs this year? Here's how to file your ITR rightIf you worked for more than one employer in the same year, make sure to report each salary and related deductions separately in the ITR form. Don't mix them up; each employer's income should be shown in its own section. This helps avoid overlaps and mistakes.

Where are India's ultra-rich families investing in 2025?A new EY–Julius Baer report, The Indian Family Office Playbook, reveals that many family offices are moving away from traditional wealth preservation and diving into global markets, private credit, and real assets.

Rs 45 lakh for raising a child? Why parenting feels like a luxury nowRising everyday expenses, pricey education and costly healthcare are forcing many young couples to think twice about kids. According to a startup founder, starting a family is personal, but money has become a key factor.

Madras High Court backs bank appointment cancellation over adverse CIBIL reportThe Madras High Court upheld SBI's decision to cancel a candidate's appointment due to adverse credit history, stressing that financial discipline is essential for roles involving public money.

No guarantees in mutual funds: Investment adviser warns against risky PF adviceAn investment adviser explains why PF money should not be used for risky bets like mutual funds with "guaranteed returns."

entertainment.headline: Paresh Rawal returns to Hera Pheri 3, calls Akshay Kumar his longtime friendActor Paresh Rawal confirmed that he was back to lead 'Hera Pheri 3' with Akshay Kumar and Suniel Shetty. The actor's announcement cam over a month after his abrupt exit from the film.

Fast and Furious 11: Paul Walker could return, says Vin DieselVin Diesel has made a promising revelation about the upcoming 'Fast and Furious' installment. At a recent event, the actor shared that Paul Walker's character, Brian O'Conner, could potentially return to the franchise.

Varun Dhawan calls out media for insensitive coverage of Shefali Jariwala's deathVarun Dhawan criticised the media for insensitively covering Shefali Jariwala's funeral, urging respect for the grieving family. Priyanka Chopra called the news shocking and extended condolences to Shefali's family.

Aamir found a friend in Salman while battling depression: Became less judgementalAamir Khan reflects on his evolving friendships with Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan. He also shares a humorous incident involving Tiger Shroff's fans outside his home.

Aamir Khan recalls refusing underworld party invite despite threats: I said noAamir Khan recalled he was once invited to a party hosted by the underworld in Dubai in the 90s but firmly refused despite pressure and threats. He shared how the experience left him scared for his family's safety.

Aamir Khan's girlfriend Gauri Spratt says there's room for improvement in his actingAamir Khan's girlfriend Gauri Spratt made a rare appearance during his interview, where she playfully said there's always room for improvement in his acting. Her comment and their candid exchange quickly went viral on social media.

Aamir Khan on struggle after divorce with Reena: Tried to kill myself with alcoholAamir Khan opened up about his painful separation from Reena Dutta, sharing he turned to alcohol and depression during that time. Despite the success of 'Lagaan', the actor said he felt lost and broken, calling it one of the darkest phases of his life.

Amid backlash in India, Sardaar Ji 3 gets overwhelming love in Pak; Diljit reactsDiljit Dosanjh's 'Sardaar Ji 3' skipped its India release amid controversy but opened to packed theatres in Pakistan. Despite the backlash, the film has been receiving an overwhelming response in Pakistan, earning an estimated $500,000 on its first day.

Tanjiro's final war begins: Infinity Castle trailer brings fire and revengeThe trailer for 'Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – Infinity Castle' has finally dropped—and it's all heat, heartbreak, and hands. Tanjiro vs Akaza is on the cards, and with revenge in his eyes, Tanjiro looks ready to finish what Rengoku started.

Samantha hits back at trolls calling her skinny, sickly with fierce workout videoSamantha Ruth Prabhu made it clear via Instagram Stories that she had no patience for comments about her body or health. She challenged body-shamers with a fierce workout video.

Brad Pitt. That's It: Deepika Padukone gushes over F1 star Bollywood actor Deepika Padukone shared her excitement after watching Brad Pitt's sports drama 'F1'. Her cheeky Instagram post quickly caught attention and felt like a fun tribute to the Hollywood actor.

Saif Ali Khan enjoys a day out at the park with sons Ibrahim, Taimur, and JehIbrahim Ali Khan shared heartwarming photos from a fun day out at the park with his father Saif Ali Khan and younger brothers Taimur and Jeh. The pataudi brothers were seen enjoying nature and playing cricket in the park.

We made plans just a week back: Arti Singh mourns Shefali Jariwala's sudden deathActor Arti Singh expressed deep sorrow over the sudden death of her friend and Bigg Boss 13 co-contestant Shefali Jariwala. The actor also extended condolences to Shefali's family,

Suriya-Jyotika enjoy vacation in Seychelles, fans call them made for each otherSuriya and Jyotika are enjoying a vacation in Seychelles, with Jyotika posting a video of their fun moments by the beach. Fans admired their chemistry and said the holiday scenes brought back nostalgic vibes.

Shefali Jariwala was planning her next 20 years: Kaanta Laga directorVinay Sapru opens up about the sudden death of Shefali Jariwala, the face of 'Kaanta Laga'. He reflects on her dedication, warmth, and the lasting impact she made on Indian pop culture.

Priyanka Chopra enjoys borderless brunching with Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy, Mira NairPriyanka Chopra received heartfelt support from her family in India, who hosted a special screening of her upcoming film 'Heads Of State'. The actor also spent her weekend with filmmakers Sharmeen Obaid Chinoy and Mira Nair, calling it a fun day.

Raja Chaudhary claims Abhinav Kohli came crying after separation from Shweta TiwariActor Raja Chaudhary has claimed that Shweta Tiwari's second husband, Abhinav Kohli, came to him in tears after their marriage ended. He also alleged that Shweta initially introduced Abhinav as a 'brother' before marrying him.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 9: Aamir's film outshines new releasesAamir Khan's sports drama 'Sitaare Zameen Par' collected Rs 108.30 crore in nine days. The film earned more than the new releases - 'Maa', 'Kannappa' and 'F1'.

Maa box office Day 2: Kajol film crosses Rs 10 crore after solid Saturday growthKajol's mythological horror film 'Maa' sees a significant box office jump on day two. The film's unique blend of mythology and horror is winning audience appreciation despite mixed reviews.

general news.headline: Terms agreed and locked, India-US trade deal likely before July 8The much-awaited deal comes just in the nick of time, as Trump's deadline for imposing reciprocal tariffs on countries worldwide ends on July 9. Last week, Trump said his administration was looking to remove all trade barriers, which he called 'unthinkable'.

Defence attache says jets lost to Pak due to constraints. Then, a clarificationIndia's defence attache to Indonesia admitted that the Air Force lost "some aircraft" early on in Operation Sindoor. The remark stoked controversy back home, prompting the Indian Embassy in Jakarta to issue a sternly-worded clarification.

Enemies will be avenged: Iran's top cleric issues fatwa against Trump, NetanyahuShirazi called on Muslims across the world to unite and strongly oppose these enemies, American and Israeli leaders, and their actions.

Can Aryna Sabalenka, Iga Swiatek, Coco Gauff finally conquer the grass?Wimbledon 2025: Eyes will be on Aryna Sabalenka, Coco Gauff and Iga Swiatek as they are set to take part in the grass-court major, which starts on Monday. Barbora Krejcikova, in the meantime, will be looking to defend her crown.

Amid backlash in India, Sardaar Ji 3 gets overwhelming love in Pak; Diljit reactsDiljit Dosanjh's 'Sardaar Ji 3' skipped its India release amid controversy but opened to packed theatres in Pakistan. Despite the backlash, the film has been receiving an overwhelming response in Pakistan, earning an estimated $500,000 on its first day.

Maharashtra withdraws 3-language policy order amid Hindi 'imposition' backlashMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announced the cancellation of the controversial government resolutions concerning the three-language policy in primary schools.

Massive protest in Bangladesh after Hindu woman raped by local politicianA video of one of the protests showed students clapping and shouting slogans, demanding 'direct action' against the perpetrators. So far, the police have arrested five individuals, including the main accused, Fazor Ali-a member of the Khaleda Zia-led Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP)-in connection with the rape of a 21-year-old woman in Cumilla.

10-year-old Delhi boy stabbed to death by father for insisting to play in rainA 10-year-old boy in Delhi was fatally stabbed by his father after insisting on playing in the rain. The accused, a daily wage labourer, has been arrested and a murder case has been filed.

Paresh Rawal returns to Hera Pheri 3, calls Akshay Kumar his longtime friendActor Paresh Rawal confirmed that he was back to lead 'Hera Pheri 3' with Akshay Kumar and Suniel Shetty. The actor's announcement cam over a month after his abrupt exit from the film.

Carlos Alcaraz targets historic Wimbledon three-peat, chases place among legendsCarlos Alcaraz will begin his quest for a rare Wimbledon three-peat on Monday, aiming to join an exclusive club of legends when the 2025 Championships get underway at the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in London.

Kolkata rape accused has history of harassing women, campus violence: Ex-friendTitas Manna, a former friend of Kolkata gangrape accused Monojit Mishra, alleged that the TMCP leader had been involved in multiple incidents targeting women during their time at the college, but that survivors were afraid to lodge formal complaints.

Sniper attack kills 2 firefighters in prolonged gun battle in US's IdahoTwo firefighters were fatally shot while responding to a wildfire in northern Idaho. Law enforcement faces sniper fire as a manhunt continues. The fire remains active with evacuations ongoing.

Aamir Khan on struggle after divorce with Reena: Tried to kill myself with alcoholAamir Khan opened up about his painful separation from Reena Dutta, sharing he turned to alcohol and depression during that time. Despite the success of 'Lagaan', the actor said he felt lost and broken, calling it one of the darkest phases of his life.

Iran could resume uranium enrichment in matter of months: UN nuclear body chiefIAEA chief Rafael Grossi says Iran could resume uranium enrichment within months, despite US-Israel strikes. He warns that Iran's nuclear knowledge remains intact and can't be erased by attacks.

Desperate stunt: BJP, Congress slam Kejriwal over slum demolition protestThe BJP and Congress slammed Arvind Kejriwal for alleged hypocrisy over his protest against slum demolitions, accusing him of political theatrics and neglecting slum dwellers during his tenure.

Wimbledon looms for Djokovic: Final shot at glory or end of an era?Wimbledon 2025: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic has had his fair share of struggles this year, but the Serb has plenty to look forward to when he begins his campaign in the grass-court major.

Stampedes, plane crash, war, natural disasters: India's turbulent 2025 so farFirst Kumbh stampede, then Delhi station stampede, then India-Pak conflict, Air India crash and now the Puri stampede - the first half of 2025 has been one of India's most turbulent in recent memory.
A wonderful guy: Trump's praise for Elon Musk amid feud over 'Big Beautiful Bill'Donald Trump called the former advisor Elon Musk a "wonderful guy" and predicted he would "do well always."

Kolkata rape case: Women's panel says attempts being made to hide somethingThe Kolkata law college gang-rape case has brought back memories of the infamous RG Kar incident from nearly a year ago, when a second-year post-graduate medical student was raped and murdered inside the RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on the intervening nights of August 8 and 9, 2024.

Gagged and beaten: Family alleges custodial death of Tamil Nadu temple guardAjit Kumar, who worked as a guard at the Madapuram Kaliamman temple in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga, was detained for questioning in connection with a theft case. His family has alleged he died due to torture in police custody.

It's offensive: Starbucks customer slams 'illegal' joke on cupA Hispanic woman in Texas says a racist joke on her Starbucks cup left her hurt and offended. Starbucks is investigating, while activists plan a protest demanding accountability and action.

IIT Bombay, IIM Rohtak named in UGC's anti-ragging defaulter listThe University Grants Commission (UGC) has flagged 89 higher education institutions, including premier IITs and IIMs, for failing to comply with anti-ragging norms. Show-cause notices have been issued over non-submission of mandatory undertakings meant to ensure campus safety.

Legs tied to neck, body stuffed in bag: Bengaluru woman found dead in garbage truckThe dead body of a woman was found in the back of a garbage truck near a skating rink in Bengaluru on Saturday night. Preliminary investigation suggests that the woman may have been sexually assaulted before being murdered.

India were fantastic under Shubman Gill: England's Jamie SmithDespite India's defeat at Headingley, England batter Jamie Smith lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy and India's all-round effort, countering criticism about the team's inexperience and calling their performance "fantastic" across the four hard-fought days.

sports.headline: Day 1, Schedule and Live Streaming: Alcaraz, Sabalenka, Paolini in actionWimbledon 2025 Day 1: Carlos Alcaraz, Aryna Sabalenka and Jasmine Paolini are amongst the top names to be in action in their respective first round matches of the grass court major.

Carlos Alcaraz targets historic Wimbledon three-peat, chases place among legendsCarlos Alcaraz will begin his quest for a rare Wimbledon three-peat on Monday, aiming to join an exclusive club of legends when the 2025 Championships get underway at the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in London.

Steve Smith shares update on finger injury before Grenada TestWI vs AUS: After missing the first Test due to a finger injury, veteran batter Steve Smith sounded confident of making the cut for the second Test in Grenada.

Definitely not difficult: Krejcikova confident before title defenceWimbledon 2025: Barbora Krejcikova said that instead of taking the pressure of being the defending champion, she wants to enjoy the game when she steps out to face Alexandra Eala in the first round.

Can Aryna Sabalenka, Iga Swiatek, Coco Gauff finally conquer the grass?Wimbledon 2025: Eyes will be on Aryna Sabalenka, Coco Gauff and Iga Swiatek as they are set to take part in the grass-court major, which starts on Monday. Barbora Krejcikova, in the meantime, will be looking to defend her crown.

Lionel Messi cruelly denied revenge as PSG dominate Inter Miami 4-0Lionel Messi's quest for poetic closure ended in silence as Paris Saint-Germain, his former club, ruthlessly dismantled Inter Miami 4-0 in Atlanta's Mercedes-Benz Stadium, knocking them out of the 2025 Club World Cup.

ZIM vs SA 1st Test: South Africa gain control on Day 2 despite Williams' hundredSean Williams scored a fighting 137 to help Zimbabwe avoid follow-on in the first Test against South Africa. Despite his efforts, South Africa ended Day 2 with a strong lead, signalling a tough challenge for the hosts.

India were fantastic under Shubman Gill: England's Jamie SmithDespite India's defeat at Headingley, England batter Jamie Smith lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy and India's all-round effort, countering criticism about the team's inexperience and calling their performance "fantastic" across the four hard-fought days.

Austrian GP: Lando Norris leads McLaren domination, Ferrari snaps redemptionMcLaren stole the show at the Austrian Grand Prix with a dominant 1-2 finish, while Red Bull faced heartbreak on home turf as Verstappen crashed out early and Williams suffered a disastrous double DNF.

India continue impressive run in Women's Asian Cup qualifiers with Timor-Leste winThe Indian senior women's team delivered a commanding 4-0 win over Timor-Leste in the AFC Asian Cup qualifiers on Sunday, June 29. The victory strengthens their position on top of Group B.

Smriti Mandhana eyes more T20I success after maiden hundred: Still work in progressSmriti Mandhana said that her batting in T20Is is still a work in progress after scoring her maiden hundred in the format on June 28. Mandhana became the second Indian batter to score a T20I hundred.

ZIM vs SA 1st Test: South Africa gain control on Day 2 despite Williams' hundredSean Williams scored a fighting 137 to help Zimbabwe avoid follow-on in the first Test against South Africa. Despite his efforts, South Africa ended Day 2 with a strong lead, signalling a tough challenge for the hosts.

India were fantastic under Shubman Gill: England's Jamie SmithDespite India's defeat at Headingley, England batter Jamie Smith lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy and India's all-round effort, countering criticism about the team's inexperience and calling their performance "fantastic" across the four hard-fought days.

Austrian GP: Lando Norris leads McLaren domination, Ferrari snaps redemptionMcLaren stole the show at the Austrian Grand Prix with a dominant 1-2 finish, while Red Bull faced heartbreak on home turf as Verstappen crashed out early and Williams suffered a disastrous double DNF.

India continue impressive run in Women's Asian Cup qualifiers with Timor-Leste winThe Indian senior women's team delivered a commanding 4-0 win over Timor-Leste in the AFC Asian Cup qualifiers on Sunday, June 29. The victory strengthens their position on top of Group B.

Smriti Mandhana eyes more T20I success after maiden hundred: Still work in progressSmriti Mandhana said that her batting in T20Is is still a work in progress after scoring her maiden hundred in the format on June 28. Mandhana became the second Indian batter to score a T20I hundred.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
